Class NeonSocket

java.lang.Object
com.quietterminal.projectneon.core.NeonSocket
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class NeonSocket extends Object implements AutoCloseable
UDP socket wrapper for Neon protocol operations. Supports both blocking and non-blocking modes.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static final record 
    NeonSocket.ReceivedNeonPacket
    Helper record for received Neon packets.
    static final record 
    NeonSocket.ReceivedPacket
    Helper record for received raw packets.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    NeonSocket()
    Creates a new UDP socket bound to any available port with default configuration.

    Creates a new UDP socket bound to the specified port with default configuration.

    Creates a new UDP socket bound to the specified port with custom configuration.
    NeonSocket(NeonConfig config)
    Creates a new UDP socket bound to any available port with custom configuration.

    • receive

      public NeonSocket.ReceivedPacket receive() throws IOException
      Receives a packet from the socket. Returns null if no packet is available (non-blocking mode). Throws SocketTimeoutException in blocking mode with timeout. When buffer enforcement is enabled, packets that fill the entire buffer are logged as potential truncation and rejected if enforcement is strict.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • receivePacket

      public NeonSocket.ReceivedNeonPacket receivePacket() throws IOException
      Receives and parses a Neon packet. Returns null if no packet is available or if parsing fails.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • setSoTimeout

      public void setSoTimeout(int timeoutMs) throws SocketException
      Sets a receive timeout for blocking mode (in milliseconds). Set to 0 for infinite timeout.
      Throws:
      SocketException

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Specified by:

      Throws:
